alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, southwest Cochise and eastern Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 845 PM MST, A large area of light to moderate rain continued across portions of far southwest Cochise county into eastern Santa Cruz this evening. This general area has already experienced rain and locally heavy rainfall since early this afternoon. Additional rainfall will likely continue to result in areas with minor flooding for several more hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista, Hereford, Huachuca City, Naco, Sonoita, Elgin, Fort Huachuca, Parker Canyon Lake, Palominas, Canelo, Ramsey Canyon Preserve and Coronado National Memorial. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
